description: Figures are depicted attacking covered wagons on a plain. One attacker yells specific instructions, demanding the attack proceed in a "counterclockwise" direction. This introduces an element of absurd precision into the chaotic and violent scene of an assault. The irony lies in the rigid adherence to a seemingly arbitrary directional rule during a desperate conflict. This specific command subverts the expected portrayal of a spontaneous or tactically fluid attack.
caption: "Counterclockwise, Red Eagle! Always counterclockwise!"
